intro: Angophora inopina, commonly known as the narrow-leaf angophora, is a species of flowering plant in the myrtle family, Myrtaceae. It is native to eastern Australia, particularly found in coastal regions of New South Wales and southern Queensland. This shrub or small tree typically grows to a height of 2–5 meters and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves. The flowers are usually small and yellowish-green, appearing in clusters, and the plant produces woody capsules as fruit. It is often found in heathlands and coastal dunes, playing a role in local ecosystems.
